page.title: 06MUNCASTER CASTLE RAVENGLASS
page.content: Muncaster Castle lies 2 miles south of Ravenglass on the A595.The house has remained in the Pennington family since 1258.The present owner, Mrs. Phyllida Gordon-Duff-Pennington and her husband,Patrick live there and,with their staff of 26 open the house and 77 acre garden to the public between Easter and September.In 1985 40,000 visitors saw the beautiful azaleas,rhododendrons,magnolias,camel lias and South beeches for which this garden is famous.There are wildfowl, bears,wallabies,rheas,parrots and owls in the grounds and an adventure play- ground. Entertainments organised during the year included a flower festival,fell race, country fair,Live Music Now and a Napoleonic skirmish. Bed and Breakfast is offered for those who may wish to treat themselves to a few days gracious living.
